definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty

sentences.english: By cock and pie it is not worth a penny.
sentences.chinese: 说句天地良心话，那根本一文不值。

sentences.english: And that should mean something, even to someone whose word means nothing.
sentences.chinese: 这总该有点价值了，就算某些人说话可是一文不值。

sentences.english: Without certification, they are valueless on the legitimate market.
sentences.chinese: 没有通行证的钻石在合法交易市场上一文不值。

sentences.english: That article is not worth a damn.
If you did not have the cookie, life was not worth a damn.
sentences.chinese: 如果你没有小甜饼，生活就一文不值。

sentences.english: This car's worth next to nothing, which's full of rust.
sentences.chinese: 这辆生满锈的车一文不值。

sentences.english: Skills are useless without jobs, they said.
sentences.chinese: 没有工作，技术一文不值，他们说。

sentences.english: Used credits are worthless on European carbon exchanges.
sentences.chinese: 二手碳权在欧洲碳交易市场一文不值。

sentences.english: Let out the secret and it is worthless.
sentences.chinese: 戳破这窗户纸就一文不值。

definition: without a penny to one's name/penniless/stony-broke
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
to toss away like a pair of worn-out shoes (idiom)
to look upon as dirt/considered worthless
to throw away like worn out shoes
not having anything at all (idiom); utterly lacking/without two sticks to rub together
